thread.title: Metro Detroit Weather: A breezy warm up today
thread.title_full: Metro Detroit Weather: A breezy warm up today

author: Mike Taylor
title: Metro Detroit Weather: A breezy warm up today
text: Steady showers and a few thunderstorms roll through Sunday evening. The chance for storms ends overnight, but showers will continue through the early morning. Lows fall into the low 40s by Monday morning. Scattered light showers continue Monday, with otherwise partly sunny skies. Winds will be out of the north at 10 mph, with a few gusts up to 20 mph. Temperatures drop Monday night into Tuesday morning into the 30s. Frost will be likely, outside the immediate Metro Detroit region. Partly sunny skies continue Tuesday, with a chance for showers up near Lake Huron. Temperatures climb to near 50째, with 51째 expected in Detroit. High pressure will bring sunshine Wednesday through Saturday with temperatures slowly warming each day. Lows will be in the 30s Wednesday, with highs in the low 50s. Lows start back in the 30s Thursday, but highs climb to near 60째. Lows start again in the 30s Friday, but highs climb into the low to mid 60s. Finally on Saturday temperatures start in the low 40s and climb into the upper 60s. Tonight: Rain moves through with a chance of thunder. Lows in the low 40s. Winds: N 10 G20 mph. Monday: Partly sunny with a scattered showers. Highs in the low to mid 50s. Winds: N 10 G20 mph. Tuesday: Partly sunny. Chance for a shower near Lake Huron. Highs near 50째. Winds: NW 5-15 mph. [Detroit weather 7-day forecast](https://www.wxyz.com/weather/daily-forecast) Connect with 7 First Alert Meteorologists: Facebook: [Dave Rexroth](https://www.facebook.com/home.php#!/daverexroth) , [Hally Vogel](https://www.facebook.com/Meteorologist-Hally-Vogel-WXYZ-296975016981225/), Mike Taylor, [Marisa Woloszyn](http://www.facebook.com/MarisaWoloszyn) X: [Dave Rexroth](https://twitter.com/rexroth7wxyz) , [Hally Vogel](https://twitter.com/HallyVogelWXYZ), Mike Taylor, [Marisa Woloszyn](http://www.twitter.com/Marisa%20Woloszyn)
